header.title: DISCO
header.abstract: This specification defines a payload format for publishing and subscribing to media streams using WebRTC-based ingestion/egress for music and other collaborations.

section1.p: While WebRTC specifies the usage of SDPs [RFC8866] and an Offer/Answer model [RFC3264] for creating connections, WebRTC does not define the precise signaling protocols over which SDPs should be exchanged [RFC8825]. In order to establish a WebRTC session between two WebRTC entities, a signaling protocol is usually used to exchange SDPs
With HTTP/S applications, WHIP and WHEP have been proposed as simple protocols to ingest and egress media streams using WebRTC.

This specification defines a payload format for communicating user media streams using WebRTC-based ingestion/egress. The WebRTC SDP payload format is transported using set and get IQ stanzas which map directly to WHIP and WHEP.
The personal eventing protocol, a profile of XMPP publish-subscribe specified in &xep0163; is used to auto-notify subscribers when media streams become available.

ul.li: Be as easy to implement as possible. This is grounded on the idea that most programming languages already have HTTP libraries available.
Usable with WebRTC-based broadcasting providers that have no XMPP integration.
Usable with XMPP client applications that may have no HTTP/S access to the WebRTC-based ingestion/egress service.
Anyone who knows the WHIP and WHEP REST Endpoints SHOULD be able to access it as well.

section2.p: The server advertises support for WebRTC-based ingestion/egress, as specified by this protocol, by including the "urn:xmpp:whip:0" namespace, as well as "urn:xmpp:whep:0" namespaces in its service discovery information features as specified in in &xep0030;.

If the server can push ice candidates patches from the WebRTC-based ingestion/egress, it SHOULD include 'urn:xmpp:whip:ice:0' and 'urn:xmpp:whep:ice:0' namespaces. If the WebRTC-based egress supports extensions, then it SHOULD also include the 'urn:xmpp:whep:ext:0' namespace.

example.caption: Client sends service discovery request to server
Server replies to service discovery request and reports capability for WebRTC-based ingestion, egress, extensions and ice candidate trickles

section2.example: <iq from='shakespeare.lit' to='juliet@capulet.lit/broadcast' id='disco_01' type='result'> <query xmlns='http://jabber.org/protocol/disco#info'> <identity category='server' type='im' name='Openfire Server'/> <feature var='urn:xmpp:whip:0'/> <feature var='urn:xmpp:whip:ice:0'/> <feature var='urn:xmpp:whep:0'/> <feature var='urn:xmpp:whep:ice:0'/> <feature var='urn:xmpp:whep:ext:0'/> </query> </iq>

section2.p: A sample protocol flow to ingest a media session from the client

example.caption: Client creates a WHIP SDP offer to publish a media stream

section2.example: <iq from='juliet@capulet.lit/broadcast' id='ih28sx61' type='set'> <whip xmlns='urn:xmpp:whip:0'> <sdp> ...... SDP OFFER </sdp> </whip> </iq>

example.caption: The server responds with a WHIP SDP answer for the client

section2.example: <iq to='juliet@capulet.lit/broadcast' id='ih28sx61' from='shakespeare.lit' type='result'> <whip xmlns='urn:xmpp:whip:0'> <sdp> ...... SDP ANSWER </sdp> </whip> </iq>

example.caption: The server pushes a patched WHIP SDP with ICE candidates

section2.example: <iq to='juliet@shakespeare.lit/globe' id='87645fg23' from='shakespeare.lit' type='set'> <whip xmlns='urn:xmpp:whip:0'> <sdp> ...... SDP PATCH </sdp> </whip> </iq>

example.caption: The server sends a user media stream PEP notification with no payload to all subscribers.

section2.topic: Subscriber requests for user media stream
section2.p: A sample protocol flow to egress a user media by the client

example.caption: Client creates an WHEP SDP offer to receive a notified user media stream

section2.example: <iq from='romeo@shakespeare.lit/globe' id='6338Vbrhrl' type='get'> <whep id="ih28sx61" xmlns='urn:xmpp:whep:0'> <sdp> ...... SDP OFFER </sdp> </whep> </iq>

example.caption: The server responds with an WHEP SDP answer for the client and the available WHEP extensions supported

section2.example: <iq to='romeo@shakespeare.lit/globe' id='6338Vbrhrl' from='shakespeare.lit' type='result'> <whep id="ih28sx61" xmlns='urn:xmpp:whep:0'> <sdp> ...... SDP ANSWER </sdp> <exts> <ext xmlns='urn:ietf:params:whep:ext:core:server-sent-events' /> <ext xmlns='urn:ietf:params:whep:ext:core:layer' /> </exts> </whep> </iq>

example.caption: The server pushes a WHEP simulcast layers server-sent event

section2.example: <iq to='romeo@shakespeare.lit/globe' id='3947254qxcf' from='shakespeare.lit' type='set'> <whep id="ih28sx61" xmlns='urn:xmpp:whep:0'> <ext xmlns='urn:ietf:params:whep:ext:core:server-sent-events'> ...... JSON PAYLOAD </ext> </whep> </iq>

<iq from='romeo@shakespeare.lit/globe' id='8453sf42' type='set'> <whep id="ih28sx61" xmlns='urn:xmpp:whep:0'> <ext xmlns='urn:ietf:params:whep:ext:core:layer'> ...... JSON PAYLOAD </ext> </whep> </iq>

example.caption: The server pushes a patched WHEP SDP with ICE candidates

section2.example: <iq to='romeo@shakespeare.lit/globe' id='54398hdg21' from='shakespeare.lit' type='set'> <whep id="ih28sx61" xmlns='urn:xmpp:whep:0'> <sdp> ...... SDP PATCH </sdp> </whep> </iq>
